title: Tunku Ismail appointed Johor regent
summary: The Sultan of Johor, Sultan Ibrahim Almarhum Sultan Iskandar, has consented to the appointment of his son, the Crown Prince of Johor Tunku Ismail, as the Regent of Johor on Sunday.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Jan 28): The Sultan of Johor, Sultan Ibrahim Almarhum Sultan Iskandar, has consented to the appointment of his son, the Crown Prince of Johor Tunku Ismail, as the Regent of Johor on Sunday.

According to Johor Royal Court Council president Datuk Dr Abdul Rahim Ramli, the appointment was made in accordance with Clause 9 (1)(d) and (3) of the Johor State Constitution 1895.

“His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim Ibni Almarhum Sultan Iskandar, the Sultan and Sovere

title: Remand extended for former political secretary, Datuk Seri businessman
summary: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has obtained an order to extend the remand of a former political secretary to a former minister and a businessman with the title of Datuk Seri for allegedly soliciting and accepting bribes from several companies that secured tenders in a ministry.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Jan  27): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has obtained an order to extend the remand of a former political secretary to a former minister and a businessman with the title of Datuk Seri for allegedly soliciting and accepting bribes from several companies that secured tenders in a ministry.

The MACC, in a statement here on Saturday, said the remand order against the two suspects, both in their 40s, had been extended for another three days until Jan 30.

title: Fahmi to bring up Umno's proposal for establishment of gig economy commission to Cabinet
summary: Minister of Communications Fahmi Fadzil said he agrees with Umno Supreme Council's proposal to urge the government to immediately establish the Malaysian Gig Economy Commission and will endeavour to bring the matter to the Cabinet meeting next week.
content:
MELAKA (Jan 27): Minister of Communications Fahmi Fadzil said he agrees with Umno Supreme Council's proposal to urge the government to immediately establish the Malaysian Gig Economy Commission and will endeavour to bring the matter to the Cabinet meeting next week.

The Madani government spokesman said there is merit in the proposal considering the boom in the gig economy, such as food delivery services.

"I see that the gig economy is rapidly growing, it is dive

title: MCMC: Beware of suspicious calls from individuals impersonating as MCMC officers
summary: The public is reminded to be cautious of suspicious calls from unknown individuals impersonating as officers of the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC).
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Jan 27): The public is reminded to be cautious of suspicious calls from unknown individuals impersonating as officers of the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC).

MCMC said the modus operandi of the calls received aims to deceive victims for specific purposes, and the caller will threaten by claiming that there are complaints against the used line and accusing the victim of wrongdoing.

It said that if the victim fails to follow th

title: PM: Malaysia to discuss with China over extension of giant panda loan agreement
summary: Malaysia will contact the Chinese government to discuss if it can extend the terms of the Giant Panda loan agreement which expires this year, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): Malaysia will contact the Chinese government to discuss if it can extend the terms of the Giant Panda loan agreement which expires this year, said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

He is optimistic that the Chinese government will give due consideration to the proposal as both countries have established strong and enduring diplomatic relations over the years.

”The giant pandas are due to be returned. I think I will take it up with t

title: CPO futures to trade rangebound next week as profit-taking activities expected
summary: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade rangebound next week with the possibility of profit-taking activities after the recent rally.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade rangebound next week with the possibility of profit-taking activities after the recent rally.

Palm oil trader David Ng sees prices trading between RM3,900 and RM4,080 per tonne.

He said the futures prices continue to linger near the psychological resistance level of RM4,000 per tonne as market sentiment continued to be supported by persistent conce

title: Daim says he will be charged next Monday
summary:
Former finance minister Tun Daim Zainuddin says he will be charged at the Sessions Court next Monday (Jan 29).

This came after the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) recorded his statement on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): Former finance minister Tun Daim Zainuddin says he will be charged at the Sessions Court next Monday (Jan 29).

This came after the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) recorded his statement on Friday.

Daim said in a statement through his lawyers that he would be facing a similar charge as his wife Toh Puan Na'imah Abdul Khalid, namely purportedly an offence of not abiding by a notice to declare his assets.

title: Bursa's rally may continue next week, FBM KLCI seen to stay above 1,500
summary:
The uptrend momentum on Bursa Malaysia is expected to continue next week, with traders remaining cautiously optimistic over external developments.

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said the brokerage firm has maintained its positive outlook, supported by attractive valuations, increase in investor confidence gauging from the higher average daily trading volume and strong foreign buying.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): The uptrend momentum on Bursa Malaysia is expected to continue next week, with traders remaining cautiously optimistic over external developments.

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said the brokerage firm has maintained its positive outlook, supported by attractive valuations, increase in investor confidence gauging from the higher average daily trading volume and strong foreign buying.

title: Ringgit likely to trade around 4.72-4.73 against US dollar next week
summary:
The ringgit is anticipated to trade around the 4.72 to 4.73 range next week, with a limited downside as the local note is technically in an oversold position, said an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said investors are focused on the incoming US data, especially the US nonfarm payroll (NFP) in January.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): The ringgit is anticipated to trade around the 4.72 to 4.73 range next week, with a limited downside as the local note is technically in an oversold position, said an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said investors are focused on the incoming US data, especially the US nonfarm payroll (NFP) in January.

The NFP is expected to drop to 162,000 versus last December’s 216,000.

title: Malaysia Airlines restoring trust as a premium carrier
summary: When Malaysia Airlines Bhd launched a new turnaround strategy in July 2019, there was much scepticism. After all, over the past three decades, the national carrier has drawn up as many as five turnaround plans to revamp its business and cut costs — including a much-publicised “hard reset” that saw 6,000 jobs slashed and the airline being removed from Bursa Malaysia and privatised. Yet, all these initiatives failed to achieve the desired result.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): When Malaysia Airlines Bhd launched a new turnaround strategy in July 2019, there was much scepticism. After all, over the past three decades, the national carrier has drawn up as many as five turnaround plans to revamp its business and cut costs — including a much-publicised “hard reset” that saw 6,000 jobs slashed and the airline being removed from Bursa Malaysia and privatised. Yet, all these initiatives failed to achieve the desired result.

title: Oil settles at highest in nearly eight weeks
summary: Oil prices rose for a second week in a row and settled at their highest in nearly two months on Friday as positive US economic growth and signs of Chinese stimulus boosted demand expectations, while Middle East supply concerns added support.
content:
Brent crude futures rose US$1.12, or 1.4%, to settle at US$83.55 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) climbed 65 cents or 0.8% to US$78.01. — Reuters

HOUSTON: Oil prices rose for a second week in a row and settled at their highest in nearly two months on Friday as positive US economic growth and signs of Chinese stimulus boosted demand expectations, while Middle East supply concerns added

title: Weak Intel forecast drags S&P 500, ends streak of record highs
summary: The S&P 500 ended a five-session streak of record highs on Friday, with Intel slumping after a bleak revenue forecast, while US economic data showed inflation moderating.
content:
The S&P 500 declined 0.07% to end the session at 4,890.97 points. The Nasdaq declined 0.36% to 15,455.36 points, while thr Dow rose 0.16% to 38,109.43 points.

NEW YORK: The S&P 500 ended a five-session streak of record highs on Friday, with Intel slumping after a bleak revenue forecast, while US economic data showed inflation moderating.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Fed, earnings and economic data to test US stocks
summary: The US stock market’s strong start to the year faces a major test next week in a stretch packed with big tech earnings, the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy meeting and the closely-watched employment report.
content:
"As long as growth remains in the sweet spot here ... the market will keep grinding up," a portfolio strategist said. — Reuters

NEW YORK: The US stock market’s strong start to the year faces a major test next week in a stretch packed with big tech earnings, the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy meeting and the closely-watched employment report.

title: Number of flood victims in four states drops to 3,002 as at 8pm — Nadma
summary: The number of flood victims in Terengganu, Kelantan, Pahang and Johor at 37 temporary relief centres has dropped to 3,022 people tonight compared to 3,432 this evening.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 27): The number of flood victims in Terengganu, Kelantan, Pahang and Johor at 37 temporary relief centres has dropped to 3,022 people tonight compared to 3,432 this evening.

According to the latest report from the National Disaster Control Centre of the National Disaster Management Agency (Nadma), Terengganu still has the highest number with 1,823 people taking shelter at 22 relief centres in four districts.

Eight relief centres are in Besut wi

title: Can digital banks crack the code and break even?
summary: Behind the sleek interfaces and services within digital banks is the significant startup cost.
content:
Foo: I think digital banks should target more retail SME clients rather than individual customers per se.

BEHIND the sleek interfaces and services within digital banks is the significant startup cost.

From establishing robust technology infrastructures to ensuring seamless operations, the initial investment in these challenger banks is undeniably substantial.

title: KJTS Group poised for solid growth after listing
summary: Building support services provider, KJTS Group Bhd, is looking at double-digit growth from 2024 onwards, leveraging strong demand in energy efficiency as well as opportunities in the data-centre market.
content:
KJTS made its debut on the ACE Market at 44 sen, a 63% premium to its initial public offering price of 27 sen per share.

title: Lessons from meltdowns
summary: Time and again, the local stock market experiences a major meltdown related to certain companies whose share prices plummet as they hit one limit-down after another.
content:
Investors, in particular retail investors, should be vigilant and not be carried away with market rumours or stocks in play due to the meteoric rise of a particular stock.

TIME and again, the local stock market experiences a major meltdown related to certain companies whose share prices plummet as they hit one limit-down after another.

title: Injecting new energy into Minetech
summary: Newly appointed chairman Abang Abdillah Izzarim Abang Abdul Rahman Zohari plans to usher Minetech Resources Bhd into a new era with a bold vision.
content:
Minetech Resources Bhd chairman Abang Abdillah Izzarim Abang Abdul Rahman Zohari.

NEWLY appointed chairman Abang Abdillah Izzarim Abang Abdul Rahman Zohari plans to usher Minetech Resources Bhd into a new era with a bold vision.

title: Another strong year in store for IPOs as SMEs seek funding
summary: Malaysia's initial public offering (IPO) market continues to look bright this year after a commendable 2023, underpinned by a high demand for capital as well as the strength and depth of institutional funds.
content:
Deloitte Malaysia disruptive events advisory leader Wong Kar Choon.

MALAYSIA’S initial public offering (IPO) market continues to look bright this year after a commendable 2023, underpinned by a high demand for capital as well as the strength and depth of institutional funds.

title: Building confidence in e-payment services
summary: Digital payments are fast catching up among Malaysians as the country strives to go cashless. Undoubtedly, the Covid-19 pandemic has hastened this process.
content:
ShopBack Malaysia general manager Vincent Wong.

DIGITAL payments are fast catching up among Malaysians as the country strives to go cashless. Undoubtedly, the Covid-19 pandemic has hastened this process.

There has also been an increase in Malaysian consumers’ preference to shop at merchants that accept cashless payments instead of just cash, further emphasising the importance of offering flexible payment
